HT_BlackJinx.text: Everyone is talking about the murder of Alven Salas. He was a member of the Morag Tong here in Sadrith Mora, you know? They say he owned some powerful artifact which is now gone. It would not suprise me if someone from House Telvanni wanted to lay their hands on it.

A friend of mine from Tel Mora says that Mistress Dratha has acquired Black Jinx, a powerful artifact which was rumored to be in possession of someone in the Morag Tong. Coincidentally, some local Morag Tong assassin was murdered in Sadrith Mora not so long ago.

I've heard that Mistress Dratha has finally got the Black Jinx ring. She's been trying to obtain it for quite a long time. Looks like Mouth Raven Omayn has finally found someone who can get things done.

Apparently, the Morag Tong is searching for the thief who took some enchanted ring from one of the assassins in Sadrith Mora. Whoever did it, they are very brave to steal from the Morag Tong. Or just incredibly stupid.

HT_FleshAmulet.text: They say the captain of Master Neloth's guard was killed for some enchanted amulet. Not uncommon for House Telvanni, of course. Perhaps the next captain will brag less about his trinkets.
The captain of Tel Naga's guard was killed, yet Master Neloth does not even seem to notice. I guess when you are a thousand year old Telvanni wizard, you stop caring about such mundane matters.
Have you heard? Someone came to Tel Naga in Sadrith Mora, killed the captain of Master Neloth's guard, and all for some amulet. Quite brazen, if you ask me.

First Black Jinx and now Flesh Made Whole? You have certainly done well for yourself in the eyes of Mistress Dratha, haven't you? I was told that she had been sending mercenaries and low-ranking Telvanni members to retrieve that amulet for the last fifty years. It must have been quite a pleasure for her that it was a woman who acquired these artifacts.

First Black Jinx and now Flesh Made Whole? You have certainly done well for yourself in the eyes of Mistress Dratha, haven't you? As well as a man could, anyway, given Dratha's... predisposition. I was told that she had been sending mercenaries and low-ranking Telvanni members to retrieve that amulet for the last fifty years.
I've been told that Mistress Dratha has at last acquired Flesh Made Whole. They say she had been sending mercenaries and low-ranking Telvanni members to retrieve that amulet for the last fifty years.

HT_NchuleftKey.text: It is not uncommon for a Telvanni wizard to be interested in the Dwemer. But it seems like Archmagister Gothren has become more engaged in these matters recently. I have heard that he has been sending scouts to look for Dwemer ruins and artifacts. Perhaps he wants to gain the upper hand over young Master Aryon, who is a well-known scholar of the Dwemer.

HT_DrakePride.text: It can be risky for low-ranking members of House Telvanni to have in possession artifacts beyond their power. Take Senise Thindo, for example. Everyone here in Tel Aruhn knew she had the Drake's Pride, a robe of great value for a mere Lawman. If she were more cautious, she would still be alive. Instead, she is dead and the Drake's Pride belongs to Master Neloth now.

You know, I just heard that Master Neloth got hold of the Robe of Drake's Pride. Apparently, he sent someone to murder the previous owner, some servant of Archmagister Gothren, and obtain the robe. There was no retaliation from Tel Aruhn, of course. That servant was just a Lawman and she brought it on herself.

HT_AurielBow.text: I recently met a pilgrim returning from Ghostgate who told me that one of the Ordinators there had been murdered. Allegedly, that Ordinator had Auriel's Bow in his possession, can you believe that? I guess only a legendary artifact such as this could lead someone to kill an Ordinator stationed at one of the most protected strongholds on Vvardenfell.

A pilgrim recently passed through here on his way from Ghostgate and brought some peculiar news. Usually all you hear from Ghostgate are stories about blight monsters, but this time was different. Apparently, someone stole the legendary Auriel's Bow from one of the Ordinators there. Who could have been arrogant enough to steal such a powerful artifact from one of the most protected strongholds on Vvardenfell?

HT_BaladasAlly.text: Apparently, House Telvanni now has a new Councilor. I think his name is Baladas Demnevanni. I've been told that he is not as eccentric as other Telvanni, but I doubt it. Why would he decide to live on the outskirts of Gnisis, a Redoran village that is also near an Imperial fort?

Baladas Demnevanni is quite interesting, even for a Telvanni. A famed Dwemer researcher, he dwells far away from traditional Telvanni lands in Gnisis, a Redoran village with Imperial presence. And now he joins the Council thanks to your efforts and much to the annoyance of Archmagister Gothren, who thinks that Baladas will support progressive initiatives of Master Aryon.

Baladas Demnevanni is quite interesting, even for a Telvanni. A famed Dwemer researcher, he dwells far away from traditional Telvanni lands in Gnisis, a Redoran village with Imperial presence. And now, when he is on the Council thanks to your efforts, we can expect that he will be much more supportive of Master Aryon's progressive initiatives, compared to other, older councilors.

I've been told that House Telvanni now has a new Councilor, a certain Baladas Demnevanni. Apparently, he resides near the village of Gnisis, of all places. I wonder if House Redoran will try to push him out of the their territories.

Have you heard of Baladas Demnevanni? He is a renegade mage who lives on the outskirts of Gnisis, and apparently he has joined the Council of House Telvanni not so long ago. I wonder if he will stay in his tower for long now. Even though we Redorans do not attack without a cause, he might deem it safer to move closer to Telvanni lands in the east.

HT_Odirniran.text: They say there was another clash between Hlaalu and Telvanni at a Velothi tower somewhere on Azura's Coast. I don't know the details, but it looks like the Yellows went on some sort of a rescue mission and got completely wiped out.
Heard about your part in lifting that Hlaalu siege at Odirniran. I hope it will teach the Yellows a lesson not to intervene into Telvanni affairs.

My friends are talking about the failed rescue mission at Odirniran. It is a Velothi tower on Azura's Coast, and a home to a Telvanni sorcerer who kidnapped a member of House Hlaalu. The expeditionary force, led by the prisoner's sister, managed to get into the tower but never returned. That Brown bastard must have gotten some help from his House.

I've been told that House Hlaalu suffered a shameful defeat at Odirniran. Allegedly, one of their members was imprisoned by a Telvanni sorcerer, so the Hlaalu sent a rescue force. However, the expedition was overpowered and faced its demise. They say that the Telvanni mage got reinforcements from his House, but it must be utter nonsense. House Telvanni never looks out for their own.

HT_AttackRethan.text: The Great Houses fight over remote frontier fortresses and towers all the time, but the recent murder of the Raynasa Rethan from House Hlaalu is different. She was killed in her own manor recently built on the Odai Plateau. No one was expecting an attack like this to happen so close to Balmora, the district seat of House Hlaalu.

Everyone in House Hlaalu is talking about Raynasa Rethan and her murder. She was killed by some Telvanni in her own manor on the Odai Plateau. All the recent conflicts between Great Houses took many Hlaalu lives, but few so close to Balmora. We can only hope that the Council will retaliate in some way. If you ask me, it is time to stop getting our hands dirty and hire the Morag Tong instead.

Have you heard? A Hlaalu noble had been killed in her own manor not far from Balmora. I am sure this was not House Redoran's doing, perhaps House Telvanni wanted to retaliate for the recent attack on their tower at Odirniran?

I've heard about your involvement in the recent "retiring" of Raynasa Rethan. Thanks to you and Master Aryon, House Telvanni has demonstrated that our reach extends a lot farther than Grazelands and Azura's Coast.

HT_AttackIndarys.text: The fights between Great Houses are getting uglier. It is as if they have forgotten about the existence of Morag Tong and decided to do all the dirty work themselves. First the attack on Hlaalu stronghold near Balmora, and now a Redoran noble has been murdered in his manor in the Bal Isra, halfway between Ald-Ruhn and Maar Gan. I can only hope that this iwll not lead to an open war.

First Shishi, now the Bal Isra. House Redoran keeps thinking that they are stronger and smarter than Hlaalu, and that they have the upper hand over House Telvanni. And yet a Telvanni managed to kill the lord of the Bal Isra. The Reds should have seen it coming after the recent attack on Rethan Manor. Did they think that the Browns would not target them as well? Perhaps the murder of Banden Indarys will make them realize their mistake.

Banden Indarys killed by some Telvanni in his own home,. He was a noble man, but he failed to see the warning in the recent murder of that Hlaalu Rethan noble. The Council is still to decide on an appropriate response, and I wonder if they will mount an attack on one of House Telvanni holdings. Those mages have become extremely arrogant if they think that they can get away with attacking Redoran strongholds.

Not only did you repel attacks on Odirniran and Shishi but it also seems like you are very successful at stopping other Great Houses from expanding their territories. First Raynasa Rethan and her stronghold on the Odai Plateau, and now Banden Indarys in the Bal Isra? You truly are a worthy member of House Telvanni. Hlaalu and Redoran will think twice before attacking us again.

HT_Shishi.text: Have you heard of the siege of Shishi? It is an old Velothi tower to the northwest from here. A Telvanni mage took over it some time ago, and House Redoran tried to claim it back. They took out most of the mercenaries and servants there, but couldn't find the mage himself. And while they were looking for him, the Telvanni reinforcements had arrived and dealt with the Redoran troops.

People are talking about another clash between the Great Houses, now somewhere near Maar Gan. Apparently, a Telvanni mage claimed an old tower, Shashu, or was it Shisha? Of course, the Redorans did not like that and sent soldiers to take it back, but none returned. Nobody knows for sure how they died, some say that the Browns sent an entire troop as reinforcements, and others claim it was just one powerful wizard. In the end, all of the Redorans soldiers were wiped out and the tower left in the hands of Telvanni.

Wasn't it you who had repelled Redorans from Shishi? And you helped at Odirniran as well? It is unusual for a Telvanni to come to another Telvanni's aid, but you and Master Aryon are quite unorthodox. Perhaps our House needs more people like you if we want to protect our interests on Vvardenfell.

I was wondering if Odirniran was just a single case of Telvanni cooperation, but seems like it is not. House Redoran failed to oust a Telvanni mage from their own territory near Maar Gan, can you believe that? I am willing to bet that mage got the same help as the sorcerer from Odirniran. House Telvanni seem to have found some interest in protecting its own.

I have heard the most outrageous news from Maar Gan. An entire troop of Redoran soldiers was wiped out right after they almost drove out Telvanni mages from Shishi. Seems like someone from House Telvanni sent reinforcements to aid their own, contrary to their infamous isolationism. I wish we could just bury the entrance to that tower, but these mages probably will just teleport away.

An entire troop of Redoran soldiers perished during the attack on Shishi to the northwest. They tried to oust a Telvanni mage who claimed the tower for himself, but did not expect Telvanni reinforcements. This is a serious blow to House Redoran, we cannot give up our territories to these blasphemers and necromancers.

HT_RecruitEddie.text: Fast Eddie is an interesting choice for your Mouth, %PCRank. No-one heard anything about him in years, and many thought that he was killed on the orders of Archmagister Gothren or Mistress Dratha. If he is still as ambitious as he was before, he will be a great Mouth to you. And perhaps a Councilor too in a hundred years.

HT_Archmagister.text: Have you heard? An outlander became the new Archmagister of House Telvanni after overthrowing the old one. This is highly unusual, and I am sure that many in House Telvanni will not accept this outlander as their leader, at least for the first fifty years or so. Not that it matters much, someone cunning and powerful enough to become the Archmagister does not need to care what others think.

I hear House Telvanni has got a new Archmagister. It is hard to believe, given that Archmagister Gothren has been at the head for hundreds of years. It is even harder to believe that the new Archmagister is an outlander. These are interesting times, aren't they?

You could have expected this from House Hlaalu, but an outlander as the leader of House Telvanni? I did hear about recent progressive tendencies on their council, but this is highly unprecedented. Perhaps we in House Redoran should prepare for changes in our own midst, if even the Telvanni seem to be moving with the times?

Everyone is talking about your quick rise to power in House Telvanni, Archmagister. And, I dare say, they will be talking about it for years to come. You have proven to be a true Telvanni, unmatched in your mastery of magic. I would never expect Master Aryon to abandon his ambitions for this position, but he must have seen you as a more worthy candidate.

HT_EddieRing.text: I hear that someone broke into Master Neloth's treasury and stole the Ring of Equity. Whoever got that ring must be quite bold: even if he never even touched it, Master Neloth is petty enough to send someone after the thief.

HT_SlaveRebellion.text: Abolitionists are getting more daring in Telvanni territories. Have you heard of the slave rebellion at one of Mistress Therana's egg mines? Someone was sent to quell those slaves but apparently they were gone by the time the help arrived.

Even though abolitionists are becoming more active here on Vvardenfell, Telvanni territories are luckily still free from them. There had been a slave rebellion somewhere near Tel Branora, but Mistress Therana had put an end to it.

I must say Mistress Therana does not seem too concerned with the slaves that escaped from the Abebaal Egg Mine. We can only hope that the new slaves will arrive soon. Only Azura knows who might become the target of her anger if the supply of kwama eggs runs dry.
Thank you for quelling those rebellious slaves from the Abebaal Egg Mine. I cannot imagine how would Mistress Therana react if her kwama eggs supply was to stop for longer.

HT_Stronghold.text: Everyone knows that younger Telvanni wizards are taking over remote abandoned Velothi towers, but now I hear that one of them is building a stronghold somewhere in Molag Amur with a charter from the Duke himself. Even though this seems like a legitimate expansion, I do not think other Great House will tolerate it.

I have heard many peculiar things, but an upstart Telvanni who gets the permission from Duke Vedam Dren to build a stronghold? Surely House Telvanni could not have decided to stop their rogue operations? They have been sending their mages to towers all over Vvardenfell for the past few years, and both Hlaalu and Redoran tried to stop them.

I never thought that "Telvanni" and "legitimacy" could be mentioned in the same sentence, but now there are rumors about some mage-lord who actually received the Duke's permission to built a tower somewhere in Molag Amur. Even if all is done properly, House Redoran will be keeping a close eye on that stronghold. You can never trust the Telvanni.

Not so long ago, Uvirith's Grave was a desolate landmark in the wilderness of Molag Amur, and now it is the seat of the new Archmagister of House Telvanni. I hear that the tower town of Tel Uvirith is protected by all sorts of unconventional guard: some say Daedra, others mention Dwemer machines, and there even are claims about Sloads, can you believe that?

I wonder if House Hlaalu will be sending an envoy to Tel Uvirith soon. The new Archmagister of House Telvanni seems to be more involved in the Vvardenfell politics compared to Archmagister Gothren. Do you believe all those rumors about Dwemer or Daedric guards that are said to be guarding the tower town?

For the first time in centuries the Archmagister of House Telvanni settles on the very frontier of Telvanni lands. Many in House Redoran are worried that this means even further territory expansion for those blasphemous wizards. They also seem to have started getting charters from the Duke, so neither Redoran nor Hlaalu can send expeditionary forces to keep the mages in line.

I know people in House Telvanni who are thinking about moving to Tel Uvirith in hopes that living on the frontier of Telvanni lands and serving the new Archmagister will help them to earn a better place in the House ranks. These are the times for young and ambitious to take over old and inert. Gothren tried to oppose this change, and look where that got him?

HT_Monopoly.text: The politics of the Great Houses are very complicated and you can never know what to expect from them. Take House Telvanni and House Redoran, for example. Apparently, the Telvanni have managed to convince several Redoran councilors to support their resolution to the Grand Council to end the Mages Guild monopoly on magic services. And yet you can be sure that these Houses will be at each other's throats in no time.

Have you heard about the resolution to overturn the Mages Guild monopoly? It has been proposed by House Telvanni, and now they got enough support from House Redoran to have a good chance at passing it. What an unexpected display of diplomacy from the Browns!

House Redoran does not always agree with House Telvanni, but it is good to see that our Houses can still cooperate. Everyone knows that the Mages Guild monopoly is unfair, and overturning it will benefit not just the Telvanni, but all of Morrowind.

Persuading Redoran councilors to support our resolution to overturn the Mages Guild monopoly is no small task. House Telvanni does not care much about politics, but this unfair policy has been affecting many of us. I hope that with the support you got from House Redoran this disgraceful monopoly will be finally ended.
What is it about you helping House Telvanni to make a case against our monopoly on magic services? It is a wonder that you have not been expelled from the Guild for this, %PCRank!

I hope you know what you are doing, trying to convince House Redoran to support revoking the Mages Guild monopoly. I do not mind a little bit of competition, but some people in the Guild might question your intentions, %PCRank.

HR_CultElimination.text: Everyone here in Ald Velothi owes you and Theldyn Virith a debt. Evil tongues in bigger cities talk that House Redoran can hardly be called 'noble' now, but you both prove them wrong. Old Blue Fin, the diseased shalk at the Ashimanu Mine, those vicious kagouti and now the cultists at Ashalmawia? Not many have done as much for our small villages here in West Gash. Almalexia's blessings upon you, outlander.
Is it right that you were the one who dealt with those kagouti on the trade route to Ald'ruhn? Three blessings to you, those beasts were the scourge of caravans lately.

A fisherman from Ald Velothi told me that you have killed some Daedra worshippers in Ashalmawia? They might not show it, but many people here in Khuul are grateful to you for this. Living under the shadow of that cursed place, we have always been conscious about who or what might be lurking inside.

I hear you've been busy in the northwest on the orders of Theldyn Virith, helping the people of Ald Velothi and ensuring the safety of trade routes between Ald'ruhn and Gnisis. I am sure many people are glad to see that the traditional values of House Redoran such as caring about common folks still live on, contrary to Hlaalu and Telvanni claims.

HR_ShishiReport.text: Other Great Houses do not tolerate the aggressive Telvanni expansion, and House Redoran has been the most outspoken on the Grand Council. They also send troops to the illegal Telvanni bases to drive the mages out. Most recently a party of Redoran warriors took over a Velothi tower somewhere near Maar Gan. What were those Browns thinking, trying to set up a base so deep in the Redoran lands?

I must admit it is good to see House Redoran finally doing something with the illegal Telvanni bases instead of just voicing their 'disapproval' on the Grand Council. I hope that their recent mission at Shishi means that House Hlaalu will not be fighting the Brown expansion on its own anymore.

Weren't you the one who brought back the report from Shishi? I am glad that Theldyn Virith had sent Brerama Selas and her troop to take care of those Brown mages and mercenaries. We cannot allow Telvanni set up their bases in Redoran lands! Pity that their leader had apparently managed to escape, though. May he rot in the depths of Oblivion!

One of my friends says that you have been in the party sent to deal with the Telvanni at Shishi. More than that, he claims it was you who found and brought justice to their leader. What a coward that blasphemer must have been, running away and hiding in some hole while his servants and mercenaries were dying from Redoran swords. House Telvanni should think twice before trying to set up another base in our lands.

I hear there has been a lot of cheering and back-slapping among Redorans lately after the success of their mission at Shishi. Let them celebrate this small stroke of luck for now. Soon they will realize that when a weak Telvanni falls, a stronger one will take his place.

HR_ClearSarethi.text: They say more and more people are behaving strangely all over Vvardenfell. Some are said to attack or even kill their friends with no recollection of their actions. If you believe the recent rumors from Ald'ruhn, a Redoran progeny murdered his best friend under the influence of some ash statue.

It is a disgrace that some in House Redoran were so quick to blame Varvur Sarethi for the murder of Bralen Carvaren without proper trial. With all the rumors about the Morag Tong trying to assassinate Athyn Sarethi, it is clear that someone sees the 'Hope of the Redoran' as an obstacle.

Lloros Sarano from the Ald'ruhn Temple had reported that someone had committed a murder under the influence of an ash statue. Our priests are now urging the faithful to bring any strangely looking statues to the Temple, but people might not even be aware of an ash statue in their home. May the Healing Mother guide us.

HR_HonorChallenge.text: You would think that Balmora is the safest city on Vvardenfell for a Hlaalu noble. And yet, Ralen Hlaalo was found dead in his manor, and recently some Redoran had walked right into Ondres Nerano's house and murdered him in cold blood. Apparently, Nerano had been slandering about Archmaster Venym's affair with another councilor's wife. Very uncharacteristic of House Redoran to resort to murder instead of an honorable duel.

Redorans have surely lost their way. Ondres Nerano might have been in the wrong, spreading all those slanders about Bolvyn Venim, but it is no excuse for murdering him in such a dishonorable manner. Why not challenge him to a duel? Why not hire the Morag Tong? Redoran is a House of hypocrisy, not honor or glory.

The murder of Ondres Nerano has been yet another blow to the reputation of our House. Hlaalu are using this incident to convince everyone that Redorans are just as ruthless as they are, and Telvanni are feeling smug after seeing how we fell to their own level in dealing with problems.

I appreciate that you convinced Ondres Nerano to stop spreading those rumors about the Archmaster. Can you imagine -- a noble of a Great House slandering around like some tavern wench? Hlaalu seem to borrow everything from the West, good and bad alike.

Have you noticed the recent shift in the way House Redoran handles its disputes with other Great Houses? Sending troops of soldiers to kill Telvanni instead of letting the Grand Council handle their complaints, murdering Hlaalu nobles for harmless rumors instead of challenging them to a duel. It is quite amusing that they still insist on calling themselves 'honorable' when they are not that different from Hlaalu or Telvanni.

HR_Shurinbaal.text: No one can tell exactly how many smuggler dens are hidden in the Bitter Coast. I heard that House Redoran had raided one of them after they traced some smuggled goods from Ald'ruhn to Gnaar Mok. It is good someone is trying to deal with this problem, but I am afraid a single attack on one base is not going to change much.

Everyone knows that the Bitter Coast is a smuggler's heaven, and it is good to hear that House Redoran has started clearing some of the criminal dens there. But those smugglers must have contacts in major cities, including Ald'ruhn. I hope they can be brought to justice too.

HR_MadMilk.text: It seemed like the nobility of House Redoran have been going through its dark times with all the assassination attempts, blight monsters' attacks and rumors of adultery. But it is a welcome change to hear some good news from Ald'ruhn -- a Redoran lord who was thought to be incurably mad has recovered once his daughter had been rescued from the Telvanni imprisonment.

The days of House Redoran glory seem to be far behind. Attempted assassinations, adultery, blight monsters plaguing settlements. There were even rumors of a Redoran lord who had gone mad and started demanding tributes from travelers. Apparently, his insanity was so deep that the Redoran Council had to send someone to kill the man. But swords will be of little help in the other challenges facing the Redoran these days.

I am glad to hear that Arethan Mandas of House Redoran has seemingly regained his senses and ordered his followers to stop attacking travelers. It is tragic how the mind can be affected by one's own daughter being captive or even killed by a Telvanni wizard. And yet I am baffled -- why couldn't House Redoran send someone to rescue her earlier? Why did they wait for so long?

House Redoran is losing its grip -- first they let the Telvanni kidnap Lord Mandas' daughter, then they ignored him slipping into insanity and shut their eyes to his band of thugs attacking travelers near Ald'ruhn. And when they had finally decided to take action, they resorted to killing the once honorable and respected Redoran lord. Could they not try and cure his madness? Ask the Temple priests for help? Attempt to rescue the man's daughter from the Telvanni?

Even the best of us can lose their mind to Sheogorath when we suffer, and I cannot imagine how painful it was for Arethan Mandas when his daughter was kidnapped. Rescuing her and restoring Lord Mandas to his senses is no small feat, %PCRank, and goes beyond just doing your duty to your House.

Arethan Mandas once was a great man and a true embodiment of the Redoran values. What a sad end -- to lose his daughter, his mind and, finally, his life. I wish it did not come to this, but I am sure you did everything you could to try and cure his madness.

Last I heard, the Mad Lord of Milk is mad no more, thanks to some daring Redoran who managed to rescue the lord's daughter held captive at Tel Fyr. Of course, House Redoran will now demand some kind of retribution, but that would be futile. House Telvanni holds no authority over Divayth Fyr. The man does as he pleases -- I suspect that the rescue attempt was successful only because he got bored with the girl and wanted to get rid of her anyway.

The Reds are trying to blame House Telvanni for the death of one of their nobles who went insane after his daughter had been imprisoned in Tel Fyr. But what could we do? Divayth Fyr might be a Telvanni, but he answers to no-one but himself. Why couldn't the Redorans send some troops to rescue the girl? After all, brute force has always been their preferred way of settlng disputes with our House.

HR_Archmaster.text: These are fascinating times. An outlander gets the support of Redoran councilors, bests Bolvyn Venim in the Arena and becomes the new Archmaster of House Redoran. Isn't it ironic that it is Redoran and not Hlaalu who now have an outlander as their leader? Seems like the Yellows are not as ready to change with the times, despite their claims.

I am surprised that House Redoran is now led by an upstart outlander. Bolvyn Venim's reputation was that of a ruthless and immoral yet effective leader. Many looked up to Athyn Sarethi as his potential replacement, but in the end it is Sarethi's protege who becomes the new Archmaster. One can hope that House Redoran will now focus on its internal struggles instead of constantly looking for a fight with Hlaalu and Telvanni.

As you have risen in the ranks of our House, you have demonstrated the very qualities that are the essence of being a Redoran -- honor, duty, righteousness. Bolvyn Venim was a great leader, but he had strayed away from these values and had led us into stagnation and even decadence. With you as the Redoran Archmaster and the support of other councillors we have new hope to restore our glory!

I cannot say that I feel enthusiastic about the new Archmaster of House Redoran. Bolvyn Venim was predictable, and his methods quite often were close to the Telvanni ways. This new Archmaster, however, is an outlander who climbed the ranks suspiciously fast -- I find it possible that this is just a ruse by Athyn Sarethi, the 'Hope of the Redoran', to rule the Reds through his loyal puppet. Whoever is in charge, House Telvanni is not going to stop our endeavors on Vvardenfell.

HR_MorvaynManor.text: First you hear rumors about strange statues that make people loose their minds, and now a friend of mine from Ald'ruhn claims that these statues can attract corprus monsters. I would dismiss those rumors as nonsense, but apparently the Temple priests have received warnings to be more vigilant and ask the faithful about any strangely looking artifacts.

What happened to Remas Morvayn is terrible, but it is a relief to know that Morvayn Manor has been purged from those creatures with your help. I expect Mistress Brara Morvayn will start making preparations to move back there, but House Redoran must ensure that no more corprus monsters get so close to Ald'ruhn.

With all its shortcomings, House Redoran still holds the line between people of Morrowind and the monsters from the Red Mountain. So it is no wonder that many were extremely troubled to hear that one of Redoran councilors was attacked by ash creatures in his own manor. Apparenrtly, the Temple and the Reds have purged the manor, but how can we confidence in the Redoran's ability to protect Vvardenfell if they could not prevent an attack in the very seat of their power?

What happened to Remas Morvayn is terrible, but it is a relief to know that Morvayn Manor has been purged from those creatures with your help. I expect Mistress Brara Morvayn will start making preparations to move back there, but House Redoran must ensure that no more corprus monsters get so close to Ald'ruhn.

Can you believe that ash monsters had killed a Redoran councilor in his own home on the outskirts of Ald'ruhn? What is the point of the Reds' insistence on hindering the expansion of Telvanni and Hlaalu territories when they cannot protect the very seat of their power from some deformed creatures?

HR_CalderaDisrupt.text: The Caldera ebony mines have been shut down after the recent slave revolt, and many here in the town are not sure what is going to happen next. Of course, House Hlaalu will try to buy new slaves or hire some workers, but there are also talks about possible Redoran takeover.

The Caldera ebony mines have been shut down after the deaths of Odral Helvi and Stlennius Vibato, and many here in the town are not sure what is going to happen next. Of course, House Hlaalu will try to find new mine operators, but there are also talks about possible Redoran takeover.

They say that the Caldera ebony mines have been shut down after a slave revolt. House Redoran was behind it, if you believe the rumors. A bit uncharacteristic for them, but also effective. The Hlaalu will need some time to find new workforce, and I cannot imagine the Empire will be happy about this delay.

They say that the Caldera ebony mines have been shut down after Hlaalu mine operators have been killed by someone from House Redoran. It is a risky move, and will certainly sour the relationship with House Hlaalu even further, but it is also very effective. The Hlaalu will need some time to find experienced operators, and I cannot imagine the Empire will be happy about this delay.

Shutting down ebony mining in Caldera is not as bad for House Hlaalu as the Reds claim. Yes, there won't be any new shipments for the Empire for some time, but the order will be restored soon. And I am sure the Empire would be very interested to know why does House Redoran think it can just interrupt ebony trade because of some childish grudge.

One of my friends says that you were behind the recent shutdown of Caldera ebony mines. Good job, %PCRank. It is just the first step on the way to stopping Hlaalu and their dubious business in our own lands of the West Gash.

I hear that House Hlaalu was dealt quite a blow when its mining operations in Caldera have been shut down, and by someone from House Redoran no less! I never thought the Reds had it in them, but it seems I was wrong. Could they have learned a few tricks from Hlaalu during all this ridiculous quarrel over ebony?

HR_DagothTanis.text: Hlaalu and Telvanni love proclaiming that House Redoran is not as noble as it was and is now more interested in hoarding wealth than in the well-being of the Dunmer. And yet it is House Redoran who had dealt with the ash monsters from Falasmaryon, and not the Yellows or the Browns.

Even with all its recent misfortunes, one has to agree that House Redoran still can protect the people of Morrowind. I am glad to hear that they have cleared Falasmaryon of those ash monsters, although it is rather unfortunate news if they had indeed lost a Buoyant Armiger at that cursed place.

Irer Nervion was an honorable man and a skilled warrior, and now he can take his place among his ancestors. Thank you for avenging his demise and killing that ash creature who dared to take over Falasmaryon.

House Redoran had sent just one man, albeit a Buoyant Armiger, to deal with the ash creatures in the abandoned Falasmaryon fortress in the middle of the Ashlands. And when the Armiger did not return, they ordered another poor soul to complete his mission. Don't you find it ridiculous that Redorans can dispatch an entire troop to take over a small Telvanni base yet they cannot afford the same force to stop a much more serious threat to their own people?

HR_AttackUvirith.text: People are talking about the recent escalation in the conflict between Redorans and Telvanni. The mage who claimed the site of Uvirith's Grave and built a tower there was found dead in her own chambers, apparently killed by some Red. House Redoran used to target smaller Telvanni bases, but this attack is different. I do not believe the Telvanni will let it go.

I wonder what will be the response from House Telvanni to the recent attack on Tel Uvirith by House Redoran. The Browns are very individualistic, so no wonder they did not seem to care much about Reds attacking unauthorized Telvanni bases across Vvardenfell. But Tel Uvirith was the largest and most prominent, although still illegal, of the recently claimed Telvanni bases. I cannot imagine the mages are going to just ignore the murder of Reynel Uvirith.

House Redoran does not enjoy fighting with other Great Houses over territories, but we have to protect our interests here on Vvardenfell. Telvanni have been ignoring our warnings for too long, but hopefully your expedition to Tel Uvirith had sent a clear message to those blasphemous necromancers.

It is true that the recent attack on Tel Uvirith is not like any other Redoran attempt at pushing back Telvanni expansion. If the Reds think that the murder of Reynel Uvirith will stop us, then they are even more arrogant than you could think. House Redoran has no business in Molag Amur and should concentrate instead on keeping ash monsters inside the Ghostfence.

HR_AttackRethan.text: You cannot deny that House Redoran is very consistent. They have been fighting Telvanni illegal expansion both on the Grand Council and in the field, but they also do not hesitate to keep Hlaalu in check as well, judging by the recent killing of a Yellow lord on the Odai Plateau. Their efforts will either make other Great Houses to accept the law or lead to an open House War. I hope it won't come to the latter, though.

Bad news from Balmora. Apparently, some Redoran barged into Rethan Manor on the Odai Plateau and killed Raynasa Rethan. The Reds probably thought that House Hlaalu will tolerate their attacks the same way House Telvanni does. They are wrong. One thing I do not understand though: why not hire the Morag Tong to do all this dirty work? Has House Redoran spent all its riches on buying ebony armor and decorating their underground manors?

I cannot believe how ignorant House Hlaalu is. They know perfectly well that we the Redorans are not going to allow any illegal expansion on Vvardenfell. They must have heard about our attack on the Telvanni base at the site of Uvirith's Grave. And yet Hlaalu nobles have been insisting on claiming land and building strongholds such as Rethan Manor without the Duke's permission. I am sure you did not enjoy killing Raynasa Rethan, but the law must be upheld.

Everyone knows that House Redoran hates the expansion of other Houses and is not afraid to use force to clear any illegal bases and strongholds. They even killed one of our most promising mages, Reynel Uvirith. And yet Hlaalu Raynasa Rethan ignored all that and kept living in her illegal manor on the Odai Plateau, until some Redoran barged in and killed her too. I sometimes wonder how is it possible for House Hlaalu to tolerate such blatant stupidity of some of its high-ranking members.

HR_LostBanner.text: It is troubling to hear that a party of Redoran soldiers has been killed by bandits at the ancient stronghold of Andasreth. You would expect a very different outcome, given the recent Redoran attacks on the Telvanni, who are much more dangerous enemies than some bandits in the middle of nowhere.

People are saying you were the one who recovered the shields of Redoran men-at-arms sent to Andasreth, may their spirit rest among the ancestors. I am sure their families are very grateful to you for risking your own life going to the stronghold and bringing your brethren's shields.

Have you heard? A troop of Redoran soldiers has been killed by the same bandits they were sent to deal with. Isn't it alarming that the Reds keep harassing Telvanni mages while not being able to protect their own territories from some lowlifes?

HR_CowardDisgrace.text: It looked like the ancient tradition of dueling as a way to resolve conflicts had started to die out. Even some Redorans have been refusing to duel. But now I hear that one of them came to his senses and faced his Hlaalu challenger in the Arena.

You convinced Rothis Nethan to fight for his honor in the Vivec arena. I thought that these are surely dark times for House Redoran if one of our own refuses a duel. Yet you give me hope that this is not true.

HR_SixthHouseBase.text: I cannot believe that Hanarai Assutlanipal was another one of these Sixth House fanatics. She kept mostly to herself, but nobody would ever thought that she was behind the bizarre and twisted dreams many of us were having lately. I doubt that she was indeed an Ashlander as she claimed -- they hate everything that has to do with the Sixth House.

You cleared Varvur Sarethi's name and brought Hanarai Assutlanipal to justice. Some of my friends might have started to forget what it means to be a Redoran, but I hope your actions have reminded them about our values.
